sentences.sContent: The earrings were a gift from my aunt.
sentences.sCn: 这副耳环是我姑姑送给我的礼物。

sentences.sContent: The clock was given as a retirement gift when he left the police.
sentences.sCn: 这个钟表是他退休离开警局时收到的礼物。

sentences.sContent: Enjoy a free gift with any purchase of $20 or more.
sentences.sCn: 购物满20美元奉送礼品一份。

sentences.sContent: This excellent cookbook would make an ideal gift for anyone just going away to college.
sentences.sCn: 这本精美的烹饪书送给要离家上大学的人是很好的礼物。

sentences.sContent: ...When people give money as gift to families or closed friends...
...the gift money must be put in the red envelope instead of the white envelope...
...please bear in mind that white flowers mustn’t be given to others as a gift to wish them well...
...from the color of the wrapping paper to the time of the gift presentation...
...M：Christmas is around the corner and I'm looking for a gift for my girlfriend...
...Often used as gift exchange and decoration...

trans.tranOther: something that you give someone, for example to thank them or because you like them, especially on a special occasion
